intro: Elaeocarpus nanus subsp. congestifolius, commonly known as the dense-leaved little satinwood, is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in dense clusters. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
